title: Understanding ΔG°
text: To find ΔG° (Gibbs free energy change), use the formula: $$ΔG\degree=ΔH\degree-TΔS\degree$$. This formula relates enthalpy, temperature, and entropy to Gibbs free energy.

title: Convert Units
text: Ensure that the units for ΔS° are consistent with ΔH°. Since ΔH° is in kJ, convert ΔS° from $$\frac{J}{K}$$ to $$\frac{kJ}{K}$$ by dividing by $$1000$$.

title: Temperature in Kelvin
text: Remember to convert the temperature from Celsius to Kelvin. Use the formula: T(K)=T(°C)+273.15.

title: Substitute Values
text: Substitute the values into the formula: $$ΔG\degree=ΔH\degree-TΔS\degree$$. Use $$ΔH\degree=143.8$$ kJ, $$T=298.15$$ K, and $$ΔS\degree=0.053$$ $$\frac{kJ}{K}$$.

title: Calculate ΔG°
text: Perform the calculation: $$ΔG\degree=143.8-298.15\times0.053$$. Ensure your final answer is in kJ.
